view

Class TDView

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • view.TDView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer

    public class TDView
extends javafx.application.Application
implements java.util.Observer
    This class represents the view of our program. The view uses JavaFX to display our Tower defense game. The view contains multiple windows for the main main, game window, and other window pop ups. The view reads in a user designed text file that constructs our map to play tower defense. The view updates every time the tick method in the model set changes to it's observers.
    Author:
    Ethan Glasberg (glasberg@email.arizona.edu), Jarod Bristol (jarodkylebristol@email.arizona.edu), Alex Gonzalez (aegonzalez793@email.arizona.edu), Patrick Dearborn (pdearborn@email.arizona.edu)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  TDView.StageButton
      This private class is a event handler that constructs a new map that the user selects and gets the according text file to generate that map.
      private class  TDView.TowerButton
      The TowerButton class is the event handler class that will check if the player can buy a tower, then they can place it on the map.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
        This method is the start method that initializes our view once the main class calls starts the application.
        Specified by:
        start in class javafx.application.Application
        Parameters:
        primaryStage - This is a Stage object that will contain our view.

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable o,
                   java.lang.Object arg)
        This method update our view each time the observable is changed in the model. Once a projectile hits and enemy or goes outside the tower radius, the projectile will decrement the enemies health and then have the bullet removed from the canvas. It also checks if the game is over, if so then a pop up window appears and the user is redirected to the main menu.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
        Parameters:
        o - This is a Observable object
        arg - This is a Object that contains either the gamestate object or the player object.

      • newGame

        public void newGame()
        This method initializes a new game for the user once he or she has just started the game. The layout and map of the game is reseted to whatever map the user has chosen or goes to the default map when the user clicks start.

      • createMap

        public void createMap()
        This method creates our entire map. The map will contain a set path that will be a linked list of nodes that contain a rectangle object. The free spaces for the user to set done towers are denoted as "free spaces" with green grass with the road being "road spaces" that will have some stone road image. Then the dead zones on the map appear as rocks on the map.

      • createLayout

        public void createLayout()
        This method creates our layout of towers and other buttons on the map. There are eight towers added to the right of the border pane along with the gold, round, and health added to the top of them. We also include multiple buttons for the speed of the rounds, next wave, music sound, stop music, and more, which are all added to the right side of the border pane below the towers.

      • getTrack

        public void getTrack()
        This method gets the according music to the map generated when the user selects a map.

      • stopMusic

        public void stopMusic()
        This method stops the music being played.

      • setMapFileName

        public void setMapFileName(java.lang.String mapFileName)
        This method sets the map file to be read so the map can be constructed
        Parameters:
        mapFileName - This the map file path
